comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [notes working again - phew!] I think this photo is early 1891 - the Hotel Australia is nearing completion, but the GPO clock and the Lands Department Tower are not yet there. Mr Hall seems to be where Taronga Zoo is now from the alignment of Fort Denison and Cremorne Point. Arthur Streeton (whose camp was at the bottom of this hill in the early 1890s) painted the same view in - 1893 - artsearch.nga.gov.au/Detail.cfm?IRN=46512 Hi-res - www.the-athenaeum.org/art/full.php?ID=46205 1896 - www.deutscherandhackett.com/node/21000011/ (sold for $336,000 ! ) 1907 - www.ngv.vic.gov.au/col/work/3068

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks BC, all the info has been put into our system :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
